results.title: Affliction
results.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Linda Reisman, Kingsgate Prod, Largo Entertainment and Reisman
results.brief_description: A dark exploration of working-class family relationships, “Affliction” stars Nick Nolte as Wade Whitehouse, a divorced New Hampshire sherif who is dealing with a spoilt petulant daughter, a furious ex-wife, and a increasingly hostile alcoholic father (James Coburn). When a hunting accident occurs in his township, Wade suspects murder and sees an opportunity to make a hero of himself and finally receive the respect of both his daughter and his father. But as the investigation becomes murkier and Wade finds powerful forces aligned against him, he begins to spiral out of control and to give into the violence and alcohol abuse that is his family legacy. Paul Schrader’s thriller, like his entire oeuvre, is as much a study in repression and masculine resentment as it is a conventional murder mystery. Wade is a classic archetype of a fool, a man who always wishes to do good, but whose abuse as a child has led him to distrust women, himself, and to react with violence and anger whenever his authority is challenged. The bleakness of Wade’s life is rooted in the history of his parent’s relationship and even the counseling of his sympathetic girlfriend (Sissy Spacek), and his estranged brother (Willem Dafoe) cannot offer him any hope. James Coburn won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for his role in this film and the entire cast is informally excellent. Based on the novel by Russell Banks.

results.title: All the pretty horses
results.creator_credit: Billy Bob Thornton, Robert Salerno, Columbia Pictures and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: John Grady Cole (Matt Damon) and his friend Lacey Rawlins (Henry Thomas) are young Texan men dreaming of an exciting life as cowboys. They set out for Mexico in search of employment, adventure and a better life. On their travels they met Jimmy Blevins (Lucas Black), a drifter wanted for stealing a horse, and they allow him to join their travels. In Mexico, they begin working for Hector de la Rocha (Ruben Blades), a wealthy landowner, raising his young and idealistic daughter, Alejandra (Penelope Cruz) alone. When Alejandra professes her love for Cole, her aunt (Miriam Colon) fights desperately to break up their love affair. When the authorities discover the boys working on the property, their past catches up with them and they are arrested for the theft of the horse. Cole must fight to prove his innocence and win back Alejandra. A coming of age western directed by Billy Bob Thornton, based on the novel of the same time by Cormac McCarthy.

results.title: The Deer hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, Barry Spikings, John Peverell, Michael Deeley, EMI/Parlophone and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The Deer hunter is a stunning epic exploration of the physical and psychological effects of the Vietnam War on three young working class men from a Pennsylvania steel town. The film is influenced by the sumptuous cinema of Visconti and Bertolluci, combining social observation with lavish tableaus of everyday life. From the opening wedding sequence to the nightmarish scenes in a prisoner of war camp, “The Deer Hunter” is a consistently astounding film that refuses to situate itself as either pro or anti War. Rather than tackling the specific history of the Vietnam war, it becomes instead a moving allegory on all war and on the destruction, it reaps on the psyches of both the victor and the conquered. “The Deer Hunter” won an Academy Award for Best Film and remains one of the best films ever made about war. With Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, John Savage and Meryl Streep. The astonishing cinematography is by Vilmos Zsigmond.

results.title: The Sum of us [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Geoff Burton, Kevin Dowling, Hal McElroy, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Harry (Jack Thompson) is a widower whose life centres around getting his gay son, Jeff (Russell Crowe), to settle down with a nice man. They live together in working-class Sydney, sharing a home, a few beers and a shared bemusement about the rites of masculinity (both straight and queer) in the post-sexual revolution 1990s. Based on David Steven’s award-winning play, “The Sum of Us” is a wonderful comedy about sons and fathers, a loving tribute to the tenderness and comraderie that can be found between men. Though some gay and lesbian critics disliked the film because of its obvious stage-bound script and the unashamed masculinity of Crowe’s gay son, by focussing on working class rather than bourgeois sexuality, “The Sum of Us” can also be seen as a film that radically redefines the boundaries of Australian masculinity and sexuality. Crowe makes a handsome and likeable central character and Jack Thompson is wonderful as the committed, generous father willing to do whatever it takes to make his son happy.

results.title: Edward scissorhands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johnny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Breaker Morant [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: It is 1901, South Africa. The British war against the Boers has deteriorated into bitter guerilla warfare. A unit of the Bushveldt Carbineers, made up mainly of Australians, is ordered by the British High Command to fight the Boers on their terms and take no prisoners, orders that were to prove fatal for Harry Morant. Cast includes Edward Woodward, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, John Waters and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Being John Malkovich [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Spike Jonze, Michael Stipe, Sandy Stern, Steve Golin, Vincent Landay, PolyGram and Propaganda Films
results.brief_description: Being John Malkovich is without a doubt one of the more surreal and original films to come out of America for some time. The inspired plot goes something like this, Craig Schwartz, a down on his luck puppeteer (John Cusack) takes on a filing job in a building on the 7 1/2 (the explanation why it’s 7 1/2 is hilarious). There, he encounters the sexy and cruel Maxine (Catherine Keener), whom he immediately forms an unhealthy attraction for, unbeknown to his timid and devoted wife, Lotte (an unrecognizable Cameron Diaz). Things get strange however when Craig discovers a small doorway at the back of a filing cabinet which ends up being a portal into John Malkovich’s mind. This of course is only the beginning. Director Spike Jonze, whose background is in music video’s (Beastie Boy’s “Sabotage” and Fat Boy Slim’s “Praise You” just to name a few) has opted to treat the film’s insane subject matter in the most matter of fact way. The screenplay by Charlie Kaufman explores every possibility that this existential conundrum evokes, at turns managing to be hilarious, weird and melancholy. Cast also includes Mary Kay Place, Charlie Sheen and Orson Bean.

results.title: L.A. confidential [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Curtis Hanson, Arnon Milchan, Michael Nathanson and Regency Enterprises
results.brief_description: Based on a James Ellroy novel, ‘L.A. Confidential’ perfectly recreates the mythology of film noir embedded within the city of Los Angeles circa 1950. Stylishly melding real and imagined Hollywood and crime folklore, the complex plot involves hookers that are made up to look like movie stars, corrupt cops on the take, sleazy tabloid journalists and of course, murder. Russell Crowe is excellent as the brutish but honest cop who teams up with an opportunistic rookie (Guy Pearce), and a smooth, star struck police officer (Kevin Spacey), to solve the gang style murder of a group of innocent bystanders in a late night diner. The investigation uncovers a sinister web of blackmail, sex and greed, implicating some of the upper echelons of L.A. society. No noir film would be complete without the obligatory femme fatale, played with sultry poise by Kim Basinger who won an Oscar for her performance. Rather than it being mere pastiche, director Curtis Hanson treats the material in a direct, earnest fashion and in doing so delivers one of the best examples of the genre for some time. Cast also includes Danny DeVito, David Strathairn and James Cromwell.

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
